comments.author: lisaiscooking
comments.content: Love the idea of adding gorgonzola. (There's a salad from Besh's My New Orleans involving a nut brittle crumbled over a salad with blue cheese that I thought of when I saw this.) The softer flavor of the warm fennel sounds great here too.

comments.author: sarah, simply cooked
comments.content: Hmm, yes, I can see that the candied pumpkin seeds would go down a treat. :-P Even without the candied seeds, this sounds like a great salad. I find warm salads feel more like a meal, especially if the weather is cool.

comments.author: Hana
comments.content: I was once an incredibly picky omnivore, who is now transitioning and expanding into the world of vegetarianism. Just found your site and am loving it so far! I've never had fennel or candied pumpkin seeds but the picture looks delectable. As weird as it may sound, I've also never had a warm salad before. I think I'd make it with apple instead of pear, or maybe an asian (apple) pear. Thanks for the ideas!

comments.author: Michael Natkin
comments.content: Hey Hana - I think that salad will be delicious with apple or Asian pear. Enjoy!
